data.title: bd-250e: add --ttl 600 to router hook registration
data.description: Fixes E12 eval failure where 'botbox hooks install' failed due to missing --ttl on claim-based router hook. Adds --ttl 600 matching JS migration behavior (1.0.11, 1.0.16).

data.reason:
Security review complete. No security issues found.

**Validated:**
- No command injection risk (uses Command::new with argument arrays, not shell)
- Input validation present (validate_name enforces [a-z0-9][a-z0-9-]* pattern)
- TTL value is hardcoded (600 seconds), not user-controlled
- Consistent with existing JS migration behavior (1.0.11, 1.0.16)

**TTL duration assessment:**
- 600 seconds (10 minutes) is a reasonable balance between claim refresh overhead and auto-release on crash
- Trade-off: crashed agents may delay router hook firing by up to 10 minutes until claim expires
- No configurability, but this is acceptable for initial implementation

**Recommendation:** LGTM - safe to merge.
